content.description: Climb more crisp edges and fun moves on this one. Use a huge flake to pull over a mini-bulge to finish up.
content.location: It is the 6th route from the left.

content.description:
The powerful start leads to a beautiful and balency vertical section of patinas. Watch your footwork, and you will dance through to a ledge. Rest up here, since you have a short bulge up high protecting the shared anchors.

Keshitsubo features great rock quality and movement throughout. It is probably the best route on the wall.
content.location: This is the furthest left route. It shares a start with Wired Branch and splits off left after the first bolt.

content.description: This goes up and left of the crag's "bonsai" tree. Horizontal jugs and edges deliver you to a balancy move under and left of the tree. Â This is short and fun.
content.location: This is under the "bonsai" tree. It is the second route from the right.

content.description: Do a very similar style start to the nearby climbs with crisp horizontals. After about 5 bolts of climbing, you will arrive to a grainy crux seam. Use the slopey crimps and poor feet to pull through. Don't worry, you can literally hang out on a no hands rest while you figure out the crux. This gets only 2 stars due to the short crux being very out of character with the rest of the climb.
content.location: This is the 5th route from the right. Look for the grainy seam up high.
